thread.title: Halloween in the 239: Treats, zombies & fun
thread.title_full: Halloween in the 239: Treats, zombies & fun

title: Halloween in the 239: Treats, zombies & fun
text:
Previous Next 
NAPLES, Fla. - Hayrides and steaming hot apple cider may not be as coveted in Southwest Florida as they are up North. 
Even so, we make up for that with a Halloween calendar filled to the caldron brim with ghastly sights and haunting good times. Oh yeah, and candy, too. 
HAUNTED GROSS WALK 
Prepare for scare. The Haunted Gross Walk is 7 to 11 p.m. Friday and Saturday and again Oct. 30-31. 
The walk, at the Collier County Fairgrounds 751 39th Ave. NE, costs $15 per person, per walk-through. Proceeds to benefit the Life’s Not “Fair” fundraiser. It’s billed as Naples’ largest haunted house. 
The haunted walk incorporates more than 14 rooms, covering nearly 14,000 square feet of terror, with haunted characters, haunted attics and a spooky graveyard finale that will leave a chill long after the walk. 
Bring costumed kiddies for Trunk-or-Treat on Halloween from 7:30 to 8:30 p.m. and a 9 p.m. costume contest. Information: 239-455-1444 or colliercountyfair.com. 
HAUNTED HOUSE 
Von Liebig Art Center : 585 Park Street, Naples. The Naples Art Association hosts a haunted house 6:30-10 p.m. Thursday, 6-10 p.m. Friday, Oct. 30, and 5-10 p.m. Saturday, Oct. 31. Cost $10 a person. Information: NaplesArt.org or 239-262-6517. 
SOUTHWEST FLORIDA TRUNK OR TREAT EVENTS 
Your car trunk wants to feel festive, too. Make it spooky or make it cute. But whatever you do, don’t forget something for your sweet tooth. 
Vineyards Community Park: 6231 Arbor Road, 6-7 p.m. Friday. Haunted House Creations. $12. Children will use an assortment of candy, frosting and cookies to design their own haunted candy house. Everything included to create a yummy work of art. Information: 239-353-9669. 
Max Hasse Community Park: 3390 Golden Gate Blvd. W. 6:30-8:30 p.m. Friday. $5 for families. Free admission for those passing out candy. Have the joys of trick-or-treating all in one spot. Join us and go car to car gathering up Halloween treats. Also enjoy music, food, face-painting, a bounce house and tons of spooky fun. For more information, call 239-348-7500. 
Boo at the Zoo, Naples Zoo: 1590 Goodlette-Frank Road. Friday-Sunday, 11 a.m.-4 p.m. Youngsters can trick-or-treat in the zoo, join in a fun costume parade, watch animals “carve” pumpkins with tooth and claw and a whole lot more. With at least one child in costume, the entire family will receive half off regular admission. Regular zoo admission is $19.95 for adults and $12.95 for children. For more information, call 239-262-5409 or see napleszoo.com. 
Family Halloween Event, Golden Gate Community Center: 4701 Golden Gate Parkway 4:30-6:30 p.m. Saturday. $3. Come with your family and enjoy a night of games, crafts, family activities, a haunted house, costume contests, a pumpkin giveaway, games, food and more. Information: 239-252-4180. 
Lamb of God Church: Car trunk decorating contest 6 to 8 p.m. Wednesday. 
In the past, according to a news release, up to 1,000 people came out to enjoy the celebration. The church is at 19691 Cypress View Drive, Fort Myers. Candy for area kids will be available. 
For more information, call 239-267-3525. 
Cypress Wood Presbyterian Church : Annual free Trunk or Treat event 5 to 7 p.m. Oct. 31. 
There will be food, bounce houses and games. The church is at 3380 Golden Gate Blvd. W., Naples. 
For more information, call 239-353-8444. 
Naples United Church of Christ : Grab your scariest costume and come Trunk-or-Treating 5 to 6 p.m. Oct. 30 in the church’s parking lot, 5200 Crayton Road, Naples. 
Patrons can decorate their trunks while passing out candy. Pizza will be served and there will also be a bounce house. 
The event is open to the public. Call the church to sign up, 239-261-5469. 
TRICK OR TREATING AND MORE 
Area shopping centers are getting in the festive spirit with trick or treating events, ghoulish costume contests and live music. 
Trick-or-Treat and Halloween Extravaganza : The Mercato, 9132 Strada Place. 5 to 8 p.m. Tuesday. Free. Trick-or-treating at 20 stops throughout the shopping center, princess makeovers, “Way Too Tall Torrie,” the scarecrow stilt-walker, pumpkin-carving, balloon animals and pumpkin-patch photo ops. The highlight will be a 7:30 p.m. Halloween costume parade with prizes at Gigi’s Children Boutique. Proceeds from the pumpkin carving and silent auction will benefit the Immokalee Child Care Center. Information: mercatoshops.com. 
Waterside Shops : From 5:30 to 7:30 Oct. 30, Waterside Shops is hosting Boo Bash, a scary celebration full of trick-or-treating, fantasy characters, jugglers, stilt walkers, live music and party favors. The shopping center is a t 5415 U.S. 41 N., Naples. RSVP by Monday. 
Space is limited to 300 people. Information: 239-598-1605 or watersideshops.com 
Pumpkin Hunt. Vineyards Community Park: 6231 Arbor Blvd. 5-6 p.m. Oct. 30. $12. Pumpkins in the park? You bet! They’re hidden all over the place! Who put them there? We don’t know. But we need you to help us find them! Includes prizes and a treat bag for every child to take home. For more information, call 239-353-9669. 
Trunk-or-Treat Halloween Event : Eagle Lakes Community Park, 11565 U.S. 41 East. 6:30-8:30 p.m. Oct. 30. $5. Have the joys of trick-or-treating all in one spot. Music, food, face-painting and tons of spooky fun. For more information, call 239-793-4414. 
Halloween Spooktacular on Fifth: Get in the festive spirit 4:30 to 9:30 p.m. Oct. 31 on Fifth Avenue South, Naples. Halloween comes alive with children’s trick-or-treating at Fifth Avenue businesses, costume contests for all ages, a pet costume contest, live music, a street dance, giant movie screen, kids crafts and live animal exhibits. For costume contests, register at the event for $15; $10 online by Oct. 30.; kid’s costume contest begins at 6:45 p.m. Register and check-in 4:30-6 p.m.; adult costume contest kicks off at 8:30 p.m. Registration, check-in and prejudging is 5-7:15 p.m. Pets will strut their stuff at the 6 p.m. Pucci and Catana pet costume contest. Register and check-in 4:30 to 5:30 p.m. Pre register here, fifthavenuesouth.com/halloween-spooktacular-on-5th. Information: fifthavenuesouth.com. 
Miromar Outlets Mall-O-Ween : 10801 Corkscrew Road, Estero. 2-6 p.m. Oct. 31. Participating stores will hand out candy to youngsters in costume 3 to 6 p.m. And there will also be music, karaoke and contests at MundoMax Playland. At 4 p.m., there will be a children’s costume contest. Prizes will be awarded for the best costume in each age group: 0 to 4 years old; 5 to 8; and 9 to 12. At 5 p.m., prizes will be awarded to the best costumed pet. Information: 239-948-3766 
FORT MYERS FRIGHTS 
Lee County boasts a fall festival, haunted Halloween walk and more. 
Bell Tower Shops : From 5 to 7 p.m. Oct. 31, the Bell Tower Shops will host “Howl-O-Ween,” a free event featuring trick or treating, face painting, a bounce house, music and a photo booth. 
The shops are at 13499 S. Cleveland Ave., Unit 161, Fort Myers. 
For more information, call 239-489-1221. 
The Calusa Nature Center & Planetarium : Come out for the 31st annual Haunted Halloween Walk: Nights of Frightening 7 to 9 p.m. Friday through Oct. 31. 
The $10 walk is open to those who are 16 and older. Tickets are available online at calusanature.org. 
There will be a kid friendly version called The Friendly Forest for children 3 to 10 years old 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. Saturday through Sunday. Regular admission is $10, adults; $5, children. 
The center is at 3450 Ortiz Ave., Fort Myers. 
For more information, call 239-275-3435. 
North Fort Myers Community Park: There will be a Fall Festival 6 to 9 p.m. Friday featuring an inflatable bounce house with a slide and balloon contest for the kids; a photo booth; live DJ; and costume contest. The first 200 kids in costume, who are up to 12 years old, will receive a goody bag. 
The park is at 2041 N. Recreation Park Way. 
For more information, call 239-533-7200. 
GET ZOMBIFIED 
Teenagers who are 13 to 20 years old can get ready for Halloween and learn how to transform their face into a scary, disheveled zombie 6:15 p.m. Tuesday at South County Regional Library , 21100 Three Oaks Parkway, Estero. 
In the free zombie makeup tutorial, they’ll learn how to do everything from crafting a severed head to a rotting toe. Creepy makeup artist Aleesha Asper will share her tips and tricks to create a bloody good look for the festive holiday. Zombie books will be on hand and all materials will be provided. 
For more information, call 239-533-4400. 
MACABRE MARCO ISLAND 
Halloween Spooktacular : From 4 to 6 p.m. Saturday at Mackle Park, Marco Island celebrates Halloween with food, games, a pumpkin patch, crafts and music. There will also be a 5:30 p.m. costume contest for kids 10 and younger. 
The park is at 1361 Andalusia Terrace and the event is free. 
For more information, call 239-642-0575. 
IMMOKALEE HAUNTS 
Halloween Family Fun. Immokalee Community Park : 321 N. 1st St. 5-8 p.m. Saturday. Free. Families a place to enjoy Halloween with a bounce house, the opportunity to create Halloween masks, music, food and fun. For more information, call 239-657-4449. 
Fall Family Fun: Immokalee South Park, 418 School Drive. 5-7 p.m. Oct. 30. Free. Information: 239-657-8575 
SAY ‘BOO’ IN BONITA SPRINGS 
Ghosts in the Garden : Everglades Wonder Garden, 27180 Old 41 Road. 9 a.m.-5 p.m. through Nov. 1. See decorated “ghosts” created by local organizations, artists and schoolchildren. Vote for your favorite ghost. Winner will be announced at 3 p.m. on Halloween. Information: 239-992-2591 
Kids’ Halloween Bag Decorating : Bonita Springs Public Library, 26876 Pine Ave. 10-11 a.m. Oct. 31. Kids can enjoy an hour of Halloween bag decorating to hold candy and treats. For more information, call 239-479-4673. 
Halloween in the Park: Riverside Park , 10451 Old 41 Road. 6-9 p.m. Oct. 31. Free. Local businesses host a booth and provide candy and giveaways to local trick-or-treaters in a fun and safe environment. Booth rental $50 (table included). Information: 239-992-6771 
EERIE IN ESTERO 
Zombie Makeup Workshop: South County Regional Library, 21100 Three Oaks Parkway. 6:15 p.m. Tuesday. Create a zombie look, from severed head to rotting toe. Creepy makeup artist Aleesha Asper will share tips and tricks to create a bloody good look for you. Zombie books will be plentiful, too. All materials provided. Information: 239-533-4400 Copyright 2015 Journal Media Group. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten, or redistributed.
